revised_title: Extension of Fermat's Theorem to Higher Orders of Series
tldr: The author extends Fermat's theorem to higher orders of series whose ultimate differences are constant. He introduces the concept of "notation-limit" and applies it to various types of numbers, such as tetrahedral, octahedral, and dodecahedral numbers. The paper also includes a new theorem applicable to all orders of series and discusses its implications for expressing numbers using different types of series.
